thread.title: Tour and Park News: Sonoma by Bike; Photos in Yellowstone
thread.title_full: Tour and Park News: Sonoma by Bike; Photos in Yellowstone - The New York Times

title: Tour and Park News: Sonoma by Bike; Photos in Yellowstone
text:
NEW NATIONAL PARK IN NEW MEXICO
The 89,000-acre Valles Caldera National Preserve in the Jemez Mountains near Los Alamos in northern New Mexico was officially dedicated this week as a national park. Wild and undeveloped, the park preserves a 13-mile-wide crater of a dormant supervolcano, home to elk herds, grasslands and pine forests. The park offers few roads and services, and hosts just 10 primitive campsites for Saturday-night stays only, with no water and electricity. Visiting hikers, cyclists, snowshoers and cross-country skiers are encouraged to bring all supplies with them. The nearest gas station is 20 miles away.
WOLF PHOTO SAFARI IN YELLOWSTONE
